direction.raw_text: . WIDE AFRICAN LANDSCAPE - MORNING At first only darkness, then the rising sun paints in an endless savanna from horizon to horizon. We hear savage drums beating in the distance coming from some unknown place. The sun clears the horizon. Suddenly it changes amazingly: the white disc goes through a rapid series of color transitions, from yellow to green to purple to an incredible
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . From it shoots a RED LIGHTNING BOLT. The sky echoes with THUNDER. We hear a HOWLING ethereal wind, but not a twig of the brush stirs as bolt after bolt of RED LIGHTNING rips the sky, with each one a TITLE or CREDIT appearing. Under FINAL CREDIT snow is beginning to fall on the burning blood-red savanna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: s a Twin Otter with the logo of some commuter airline. It buzzes along over pleasant countryside, through a sky that's almost unnaturally serene and filled with fleecy white clouds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are just two passengers in the cabin. One is DALE ARDEN, a great looking dark-haired girl sitting by herself and reading a book entitled "KARATE FOR THE SINGLE GIRL.... A Guide to Survival In The City." A few rows forward, near the open door into the pilots' compartment, is FLASH GORDON. He's studying a football play-sheet, one of those diagrammed things with X's and 0's for the players and dotted-line arrows indicating the directions of movement. Suddenly the plane makes a violent bump. It almost knocks the book from DALE'S hand. She looks out the window with sudden fright, tossing hair out of her eyes, in a gesture that's habitual to her in moments of stress. There's nothing to see outside but the pretty clouds. She looks forward again and watches FLASH standing up easily, leaning in t..e cockpit doorway to speak to the PILOTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CO-P:ILOT, DALE, FLASH, PILOT)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was that, fellas?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clear-air turbulence, is all. Nothing
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But nothing you'd want to toss a third-down pass through either -- (Grinning back at
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I have an autograph for my kid, Mr. Gordon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure -- my pleasure. As FLASH takes a bit of paper from the CO-PILOT, the plane takes another jolt, even more violent than the first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. Call Westchester Approach, see what they've got.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sure hope we don't have to turn back. I mean this is first day of training camp, I wouldn't want to be
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seat-belt time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: starts back to his seat. The plane jumps again, shudders violently. He holds on, calls up front:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe it'd be smoother if you went
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you SHUT UP? (as FLASH's head
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Mister Flash Gordon, they have their hands full -- just let 'em drive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The plane buffets. FLASH is sent reeling, catches hold of the rack above DALE, lowers himself into the seat next to her. He buckles fast, takes out a candy bar and offers it to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you're nervous, it can help to chew on something
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks a lot -- I look dumb enough to take candy from a stranger?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not a stranger exactly -- You know my name.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who doesn't. Number one draft pick, cover of PEOPLE mag -- what'd the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sign you for, eighty-nine million? Big deal!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, I hate flying -- I'm Dale Arden it's crazy of me to hate flying -- I'm a travel agent, you see? -- I've just been checking out a little hotel in Vermont -- can I still have that candy bar? (and in the same breath) Are we going backward?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Backwards?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holy cow! Look at the clouds!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pretty white clouds are changing above and beginning to surround the airplane. Over the engines we HEAR that same ethereal wind rising which we heard in the opening. Slowly and terrifyingly, the sun starts turning BLOOD RED. The clouds race faster, faster, until they are actually streaming past the plane from behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and DALE -- faces bathed in the eerie light. Speechless-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: grasps the football player's hand with all her strength.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a huge and rambling, antique, standing in semiruinous isolation in a pretty country landscape. The sun has turned
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . the SAME BLOOD RED we saw from the airplane, and clouds race across it with unnatural velocity. In the center of the greenhouse rises a glass-paned tower through which we glimpse something MIRROR BRIGHT. Floating high in the air above the structure are several silvery helium- filled balloons, secured by wires. As we move closer, we discern a MAN moving about actively on a platform inside the central tower, about half-way up:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The man is DR. HANS ZARKOV: big, bearded, feverish looking and seemingly half mad with exhaustion. In striking contrast to the antique greenhouse exterior, here there are all kinds of computers and displays connected together in a slapdash fashion. Quantities of neglected plants, most brown and dead or dying, hide the works in here from outside view. As Zarkov runs around throwing switches and eyeing displays, a grim-voiced TV. NEWSMAN is appearing and speaking from a good-sized television screen above the main control console:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The extraordinary weather disturbances reported from Africa this morning are now crossing the Atlantic, and are expected to reach the East Coast of the United States by noon. According to scientists at NASA, the Earth is being struck by an immense stream of cosmic energy, apparently the result of some catastrophic stellar accident beyond the reaches
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: whirls, slams the TV SOUND OFF and yells at the silently mouthing NEWSMAN on the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fools! Can't you understand? This is no accident-- it's an ATTACK! An attack planned by a MIND! This is
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a scared looking assistant, comes running up the stairs with a computer print-out sheet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Zarkov! Look at the report from the last balloon!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: grabs it, eyes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I predicted it, didn't I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir -- you sure did. And this funny sun too --- ZARKOV Ozone layer starting to crack up. By tonight Carbon dioxide will be combining with free nitrogen to form -- (breaks off, crumpling
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, this is it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, the President is on the TV behind
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell do I care? I tried to warn him -- he called me mad, like all the others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The TV screen EXPLODES in a fine shower of glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Time for us to go, Munson. Get your toothbrush and whatever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up. Up and at him. Stunned, MUNSON turns his head and glances at something big and MIRROR BRIGHT gleaming behind foliage in center of tower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're crazy! Perfectly calm except for the maniacal glint in his eyes,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pulls out a revolver and points it at MUNSON.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't handle the capsule alone get your toothbrush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The PILOTS watch these clouds also, transfixed with disbelief. They speak with that incredible calmness characteristic of professional airmen in a moment of impending catastrophe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's ,e word from Westchester Approach, Bill?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Zip. All chanels dead. (Reacting to the panel) Say, get a load of the VOR's.... The directional needles are going crazy. All the instruments are going crazy. Displays flash impossible symbols. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gapes at them a moment, then returns his gaze to the sky and swallows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the left, about six o'clock high...... The racing stream of clouds is parting open like in some surreal painting. From the cortex LASER-like bolts of RED LIGHTNING shoot out. Like a missile, one zaps right over the plane's nose with a horrible crackling NOISE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold on tight, let's put baby down right here...... The CO-PILOT reaches up and hits the flap control. There is a whooshing crackling ZAP! The whole cockpit FLARES OUT with an intolerable blinding flash of RED LIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cockpit door flys off its hinges, admitting a gale of wind that scatters FLASH'S play sheets like autumn leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: unsnaps his belt, leaps up and races forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The TWO PILOTS are gone, vanished without trace. Wind from the shattered windows assaults FLASH as he charges in. He stumbles forward as the plane noses into a dive. Recovering he scrambles into the left-hand seat, grabs hold of the bucking wheel yoke, pulls back and kicks at the rudder pedals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lurches in against the tornado.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you fly it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can fly all right -- I've had a couple of lessons! -- just don't if I can land! (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grab that other wheel! Help me pull her up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: staggers into the co-pilot's seat, pulls back on the wheel in front of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh boy! Ever hear about the man who fell ninety stories from a window and didn't break a bone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No but I'd sure like to! How'd The man fall ninety stories didn't break a bone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The window was ninety-one stories up!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THROUGH THE BROKEN WINDSHIELD The Earth is approaching fast, wheeling and tilting. We get a glimpse of a strange greenhouse structure at the end of a flat area. Another barrage of crackling RED LIGHTNING BOLTS shoot all around the plane but just miss it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brace yourself I'm aiming at that field up ahead!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Its thousands of panes reflect the RED SUN and the RED BOLTS which rain down in intermittent bursts. One strikes an end of a gallery, exploding glass and foliage. From inside, we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a furious echoing VOICE:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see you, Munson! Come out or I shoot!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is on the lower stairs of the tower, aiming his revolver. MUNSON emerges from some dry brown bush where he was hiding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's it matter if I'm shot or go up in that thing? I'm a goner either way, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course -- I admit that! But this way you'll be giving your life for a chance of saving Earth! Haven't you any spirit at all??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goodbye, Doctor -- they were all right about you. Have a nice trip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: starts walking away, toward the door at the end of the long side wing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tell you I can't take it off alone! If you won't come, who will I find? If you woo't come, who will I find:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ignores him totally, keeps walking away. ZARKOV lifts his revolver and draws a bead on the man's back. Just as he is about to shoot, he reacts to something outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Amazingly, a Twin Otter is gliding in to a horribly rough landing in the field outside. The plane hits on one wheel, bounces into the air, comes down again and keeps right on rolling toward the greenhouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - FEATURE MUNSON SEEING the onrushing plane, freezing an instant then starting to run. He hardly gets five yards before the Twin Otter comes
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: through the greenhouse wall, burying MUNSON totally under the wreckage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crazily angled, filled with dust and smoke. Dazed, blood on his forehead, FLASH struggles from his seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dale! Are you all right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm terrific. (WEAK SMILE) Flash Gordon, you have just made me a Giant fan for life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on -- let's get out before she blows!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: helps her from the wrecked seat, wheels and kicks out the emergency exit in the cockpit area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lowers DALE to the ground, jumps down after her. ZARKOV is there, smiling at them in a strange way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. i'm Flash Gordon, this is Miss Dale Arden -- ZARKOV (MEANS IT) Delighted to see you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This crazy storm knocked us down could we use a phone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Certainly. Just follow me -- up those stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some weather huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It will get worse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turns and smiles at them again as they start up the tower stairs. SUddenly DALE stops short, staring at ZARKOV with a funny expression.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're Dr. Hans Zarkov!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hesitates just an instant, the nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw you in PEOPLE mag. After you left NASA, remember? It said you were utterly --- DALE breaks off, almost biting her tongue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Insane? Off my rocker?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I forget what it said: (TURNING HASTILY) Flash, let's find some other phone, okay? I'm sure Dr. Zarkov is very busy.......
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is baffled, but he gets her urgent look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, all right -- but it seems to me we ought to -- Now it's FLASH'S turn to break off. ZARKOV is pointing a gun at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up the stairs to the tower! Ahead of me -- quick! -- (as they gape at him,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quick I said: We haven't much time -- Earth is being attacked! -- there's only one slim chance of saving it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister, you are insane!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of ether-wind increases. Storm of RED LASER BOLTS. Glass showers them as parts of the green house EXPLODE and dry foliage bursts into FLAME.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up the stairs -- RUN!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: jabs the revolver into DALE'S back. RED BOLTS zap around. FLASH whispers to her as they start running up ahead of ZARKOV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go with the flow -- wait for a chance! Below them, bottom of staircase disintergrates in a RED FLASH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: rips away a screen of foliage, revealing a MIRROR BRIGHT capsule, seamless but for one door. He yanks that open. On every side things are blowing up and burning under the merciless rain of bolts. One strikes the capsule head on, but does not even leave a mark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I need your help to take off! Get in or I shot you dead!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: gasps and shrinks back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take off for where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God only knows -- whatever black corner of space this is coming from -- wherever HE is!. -- we'll plunge into the devil's heart and destroy him! We'll die ourselves, of course, but our names will be honored till the end of time!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Doc -- I don't book kamikaze tours -- never.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is poised to jump, but ZARKOV suddenly pushes DALE off- balance, INTO the capsule. FLASH leaps after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is curiously transparent from the inside, mirrored only on the exterior. There are some controls and displays, but in general the interior is severely ascetic: as far removed from conventional spacecraft as ZARKOV's solitary genius is from everyday science. Immediately starting to set switches in a frenzy of activity,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: waves the gun at FLASH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down there! Foot on the red pedal!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flash! Sack him!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wheels and pulls the door shut. FLASH jumps him. He punches ZARKOV in the gut. ZARKOV slams him back with the well-known strength of a madman. FLASH clobbers him again. Falling, ZARKOV dives sidewards and hits a switch. The capsule WHINES SOFTLY and begins to WHIRL. Looking out through the transparent wall, it is as if the capsule itself was motionless and the scene outside is whirling. What's left of the greenhouse is under a constant rain of those
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: flashing fire that makes us dizzy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: staggers to his feet and finds DALE, folds his arms around her protectively. The centrifugal force is rapidly increasing now, throws them both against the wall. Faster and faster, whirling, the force presses DALE'S body back against FLASH'S until they are almost one flesh. We move over and find ZARKOV plastered against another part of the whirling capsule, his face drained white and distorted by the terrific G-Force operating here now, his lips moving as he speaks with enormous effort:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Friendship...Built this to send to them in...Friendship...The end now...End of the world....Unless we (every sound an effort
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unless...We...Three...Can...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: eyes close. He loses consciousness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Totally ablaze within now, one huge fantastic jewel of fire. The whole central tower explodes outward. From the inferno a MIRROR-BRIGhT capsule slowly rises, hovers, begins picking up speed again as it ascends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whirling, whirling, invincibly unharmed by the LASER BOLTS which glance off it again and again, accelerating up into space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The EARTH recedes below into a ball, RED-HUED' under the fantastic sun. A fast approaching light FLARES up against the mirrored surface and is recognised as our MOON. It flashes past, follows EARTH into e distance. All around, the sky darkens into the void of space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . They hurtle past the capsule in rapid sequences:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sudden gauntlet of careening ASTEROIDS, all sizes, from tiny zingers to one almighty tumbler big as AFRICA. Mammoth JUPITER with thirteen moons and its atmosphere of deadly methane clouds more than 1000 miles deep. The RED PATCH on its surface is a storm 20,000 miles across which has raged without intermission for 200 EARTH centuries. Through the RINGS OF SATURN in a dazzling LIGHTSTORM of blazing ice crystals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: outermost URANUS. One after another the planets are left hurtling behind, wheeling in their concentric orbits, the entire SOLAR SYSTEM dwindling into nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It tilts and wheels wondrously as the Capsule passes through the middle of it. Considering that this Nebula is probably a million light-years from edge to edge, we get some notion of the Capsule's speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curving light-rays from another galaxy are drawn fantastically together and then simply DISAPPEAR as they are pulled in by the unimaginable gravitation force of is THING. we SEE the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tiny, curving, and spinning along amidst the mind- blowing display of light rays, sucked along with them then simply DISAPPEARING as it too enters the void.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Visible again, gleaming in an AMBER GLOW. Suddenly a dancing grid of lines appears OVER IT, making us realise that we must be SEEING IT on some kind of screen. It BLURS out of focus, comes back again more sharply as some adjustment has apparently been made.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - EYES OF MING THE MERCILESS Deep in shadow, gleaming with evil amusement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Curve of lip, flare of nostril, fold of eyelid, gleam of shaven scalp, each a menacing landscape of sensual shadow as
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) They survived our Black Hole -- 14.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Hail Ming! Shall I drown them in the Sea of Fire?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Later, Klytus -- I think we will look at them first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the transparent walls as the spinning motion is rapidly SLOWING DOWN. The three voyagers are crumpled on the floor against the wall in strange attitudes, FLASH'S arms still holding DALE. They seem semi-conscious, as if dropped. An AMBER GLOW bathes them, and soon we see its source. A huge planet wheels into view through the transparent wall. It is MONGO. Its curved surface is a pure sea of AMBER FIRE molten lava, with great tongues of flame erupting horrifically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: blinks, struggles to focus his eyes. He succeeds, with horror SEES where they are headed. Making a choking sound, ZARKOV stirs and tries to crawl over to a control panel. He pushes switches. Nothing happens. The CAPSULE keeps on going down. A great leaping tongue of fire licks it. Suddenly, just as destruction seems imminent, the capsule miraculously changes its flight path and soars above the remaining flames. It races through them. A shadow passes over MONGO as the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: passes through a wall of PURPLE VAPOR and emerges above a totally different landscape. A dozen VARIOUS COLORED CLOUDS sweep past in silent majesty. The CAPSULE slows, hovers starts straight down into a sea of high grass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the distant B.G. against an extraordinary SUNSET SKY, rises the shimmering CITY OF MONGO.... a place of many levels, golden tiers and turrets, towers, flags and pennants. It is like something dreamed. Several STRANGELY ARMORED MEN watch the MIRROR-BRIGHT CAPSULE descending slowly. The LEADER waves and they all start toward the CAPSULE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gentle bump as the thing touches down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By God, we did it! We made it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Made it where, Doctor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. Suddenly DALE gasps, reacting to something she SEES through the transparent-from-within wall. They all look around and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: those STRANGE MEN approaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't. Suddenly I like it in here just fine -- EXT. GRASSY AREA - DAY (ARMORED MEN, FLASH, LEADER, ZARKOV) The door of the CAPSULE is opened from the inside. ZARKOV and DALE and FLASH get out. THE MEN stop. Long beat as the two parties gaze at each other, the first human eye ever to see an extraterrestrial being. FLASH walks up to the leader.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello -- my name's Flash Gordon -- can you understand me? (SILENCE) We're from EARTH -- we come as friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Extend your hand! That's the gesture of friendship known everywhere! With a warm grin, FLASH extends hi right hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! With lightning speed a manacle is slammed on FLASH'S wrist and he is thrown to the ground as other RED MEN advance to handcuff DALE and ZARKOV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are prisoners. I will take you now to Ming the Merciless, Ruler of the universe!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hail, Ming!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Groggily, FLASH lifts his head towards ZARKOV.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks, Doctor -- next time I'll call my own play.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THROUGH OPENING (DALE, FLASH) Another strange glimpse through an opening. Some fierce tethered BEAST is being goaded and tormented by MONGO MEN, as in an Elizabethan bear-baiting. On the floor lies the tor n body of one MAN who apparently got too close.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: has one brief horrified GLIMPSE of this, then turns her head away and shuts her eyes as she's marched along.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just do what I'm doing. Flash -- FLASH What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shutting my eyes -- dreaming I booked us to Disneyland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A gigantic STATUE comes into view amidst topless columns at the end. Light plays over it in ever-shifting patterns. As we come nearer, we SEE that this STATUE is cut out in the middle to form a throne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sits in the throne niche, silent, gazing down on the PRISONERS as they are marched to a halt before him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hail, Ming! Hail, Great One Without Mercy! A hundred reduplicated ECHOES of that shout ring through unseen reaches of the palace. MING bends his head slightly in acknowledgement, points idly at the ARMORED MEN at the left of the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As FLASH, DALE and ZARKOV are marched along by many ARMORED MEN, perspectives are bewildering, curvilinear, surfaces
direction.name: direction

modifier: ARMORED MAN, AURA, DALE, FLASH, KLYTUS, LEADER, MING, VOICES, ZARKOV

direction.raw_text: . bending away into caverns of gloom without measurable dimension. We pass an archway opening into what seems to be an AMUSEME- NT ARCADE. Glimpse of MONGO PEOPLE playing amazing electronic games, while MONGO GO-GO GIRLS cavort on a platform to unearthly music.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fantastic -- into a Black Hole and out the other side -- to this. Who said Hans Zarkov was mad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're mad. Look down over a balcony from a MOVING POV. A fencing glass is in session. SIX PAIRS OF MEN go at each other with magic swords which give off pyrotechnical displays each time the blades clash. Thrust, parry, SLASH! The head of one duellist
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in a bloodless fountain of fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got us into this -- HOW DO WE GET OUT?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out? Why? We're being taken to Ming -- getting at him is our only hope of saving EARTH. It's perfect!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Zarkov, I'm about to show you what it feels like to be clipped by a New York Giant -- DALE Flash, it's no use - he's too crazy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Step forward, Soldier. The designated one marches two paces forward, halts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you loyal to Ming? Would you die for him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gladly!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fall on your sword.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Instantly the ARMORED MAN pulls his sword, rips open his breast-plate, sets the sword hilt-down on the floor and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on to the fatal point. With a little cry of horror, DALE shrinks back into FLASH'S arms.

(Dropping his voice) Pathetic Earthlings, forever wondering if you are alone in the universe -- beaming you plaintive messages into to the void for anything that might hear you -- even hurling your bodies out into it -- and all without the faintest inkling of who or what is out here. If you had known anything -- anything at all about the true nature of the universe, you would have hidden from it, in terror! There is a low throaty LAUGH from the shadows. FLASH and

direction.raw_text: tense, ready to spring.

direction.raw_text: As he swivels his head for a quick look. He freezes, gives a CRY of unmitigated rage. FLASH seizes the instant, thrust his sword. The blade goes into MING up to the hilt. FLASH pulls it out. There isn't a drop of blood. MING just stands there , smoking, in spectacular fashion into the atoms of which he was constituted. MING is just GONE.

direction.raw_text: looks upwards at FLASH, standing with his sword atop the statue. There is a clatter as AMAZONS cast away their spears. A cry goes up as if from one throat!

direction.raw_text: It is a scene of peace now. HAWKMEN and SOLDIERS join in tending their wounded. Formerly fierce AMAZONS act as gentle nurses. MOVE OVER this to find FLASH, DALE and ZARKOV standing together, looking up at the terrific sky-shadow, FLASH with an arm around DALE'S shoulder. He glances at her tenderly, is surprised to see tears on her cheeks.
